column5: I decided to carve my pumpkin tonight.    Anyone else have theirs carved yet?
Very artsy Dan nice job, bet ya the fillets look good too .
That's a great idea.  How long did that take?  You gunna cook up the seeds?
Thanks guys!    It took about 15 minutes to draw and 30 minutes to cut. I never have cooked up the seeds, maybe I'll try it next year.
I love the seeds.  Cooked tastes great, or eat them raw and they are very good for you.
cooked seeds with salt Dan and LOOK OUT!  *edit* And the folks come a running!!!

Cook the seeds!! Wash them off, then lay them out on a cookie sheet. Coat them with garlic salt, when they start to turn brown flip them over with a spatula coat again with garlic salt. When that side starts to turn brown, they are done. Let them cool off , then fill up large zip lock bags with them and courier them off to me!!
That's a great job, Dan. Fishing related too!
Very nice art work there Dan.  As for the seeds. Roasted in the oven with roasted garlic and pepper spice. I do this with plain almonds aswell.

My pumpkin this year was of the G. Loomis fish logo. Last weekend the kids and I had a blast carving pumkins! It was my first time in years, and I'm glad I joined in this year.  The kitchen was one heck of a mess though.  We put our seeds on a tray, coated with a little oil, seasoning salt, garlic salt, onion salt and a little pepper. Cooked on 350 for about 35 minutes, and turned at the half way point. Turned out darn tasty, but I barely got any because of the kids chowing them down!  The pumpkin was too small, so the pic sucks, lol
Im actually nippin at a bag full of pumpkin seeds as i read this lol
